anyOf.description: The default strategy. This strategy currently uses a `max_chunk_size_tokens` of `800` and `chunk_overlap_tokens` of `400`.
anyOf.title: Auto Chunking Strategy

anyOf.description: Customize your own chunking strategy by setting chunk size and chunk overlap.

chunk_overlap_tokens.description:
The number of tokens that overlap between chunks. The default value is `400`.

Note that the overlap must not exceed half of `max_chunk_size_tokens`.

max_chunk_size_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens in each chunk. The default value is `800`. The minimum value is `100` and the maximum value is `4096`.

anyOf.title: Static Chunking Strategy

chunking_strategy.description: The chunking strategy used to chunk the file(s). If not set, will use the `auto` strategy. Only applicable if `file_ids` is non-empty.

description.description: A description for the vector store. Can be used to describe the vector store's purpose.

expires_after.description: The expiration policy for a vector store.

anchor.description: Anchor timestamp after which the expiration policy applies. Supported anchors: `last_active_at`.

days.description: The number of days after the anchor time that the vector store will expire.

expires_after.title: Vector store expiration policy

file_ids.description: A list of [File](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/files) IDs that the vector store should use. Useful for tools like `file_search` that can access files.

anyOf.description:
Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be
useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured
format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard.

Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings
with a maximum length of 512 characters.

name.description: The name of the vector store.

schema.description: A vector store is a collection of processed files can be used by the `file_search` tool.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the vector store was created.

expires_after.description: The expiration policy for a vector store.

anchor.description: Anchor timestamp after which the expiration policy applies. Supported anchors: `last_active_at`.

days.description: The number of days after the anchor time that the vector store will expire.

expires_after.title: Vector store expiration policy

anyOf.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the vector store will expire.

cancelled.description: The number of files that were cancelled.

completed.description: The number of files that have been successfully processed.

failed.description: The number of files that have failed to process.

in_progress.description: The number of files that are currently being processed.

id.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

anyOf.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the vector store was last active.

Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be
useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured
format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard.

Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings
with a maximum length of 512 characters.

name.description: The name of the vector store.

object.description: The object type, which is always `vector_store`.

status.description: The status of the vector store, which can be either `expired`, `in_progress`, or `completed`. A status of `completed` indicates that the vector store is ready for use.

usage_bytes.description: The total number of bytes used by the files in the vector store.

schema.title: Vector store
